item.title: Horrible, Slow, Stupid, Scary Build Process
item.description: So we’ve rolled out a new build process at work. I’ve started working with a new company, and when I arrived, the build process for a new environment consisted of a 20 page manual somebody had written. The process of putting a build on an environment was slow, the manual had steps missing that everyone just ‘knew’, the process had multiple failure points, and was more or less a complete disaster.

item.title: Setting up a .NET build server WITHOUT installing Visual Studio
item.description: My client tasked me with upgrading their build server. Today, their platform builds VS 2080 solutions in .NET 3.5 - and I’ve been pushing to upgrade everyone to Visual Studio (VS) 2010 and eventually .NET 4.0. I want to upgrade the server to build a VS 2010 solution in .NET 3.5. This will allow everyone to upgrade to VS 2010 while leaving the task of upgrading the production web servers to another day.
